data.title: Bug: In Ubuntu Linux, gdx-setup.jar builds an incomplete project when the libGDX directory name contains a space
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Unzip libGDX 1.4.1 to a directory that contains a space. I used "libGDX 1.4.1"
2. Open up terminal, and navigate to the directory where you extracted libGDX
3. run the command "java -jar gdx-setup.jar"
4. Create a test project
5. Gdx-setup throws an IOException:

"Cannot run program "/home/<user>/Destkop/libGDX" (in Directory "home/<user>/Destkop/libGDX 1.4.1/bug") error=2, No such file or directory..."

Note that removing the space from the file directory and replacing it with a dash solves the problem.
Also note that in linux command line, accessing a directory with a space would look like:

cd /libGDX\ 1.4.1/bug

Where there's an escape character to denote the space.

data.title: Change to CMMotion, implement magnetometer
data.body:
- Removes deprecated use of UIAcceleration, replaces with CoreMotion's accelerometer data
- Adds Magnetometer support
- Implement azimuth, pitch and roll

**NOTE:** Need some help with this one, azimuth is not giving correct values. 
Pitch and roll are giving correct values when compared to my android, but Azimuth calculation is completely off, and I'm not too sure why.

data.title: Lwjgl backend doesn't support OpenGL ES 3.2+ #2087
data.body:
Fixes several issues that were preventing libgdx from working with OpenGL 3.2 core profiles.
- In core profiles glGetString(GL_EXTENSIONS) is deprecated, so a new mechanism is used to test for extensions.
- In core profiles VAOs are mandatory, and storing vertex data in client memory is not allowed. So VertexArray and VertexBufferObject cannot be used. I've created a new VertexData implementation, VertexBufferObjectWithVAO. This is based on the VertexBufferObject code, but is uses VAOs to bind the VBO instead of setting the attributes and data for each draw call. I modified Mesh to use the new implementation when GL30 is present, and I modified the users of the "expert" mesh constructor to also test for this case.

With these changes SpriteBatch and Mesh function properly on my machine. No shader changes were needed.

I have tested this on my windows desktop. My code uses SpriteBatch, BitmapFont, and custom meshes and shaders extensively.

I have not tested on Mac, Mobile, or GWT. (I strongly suspect GWT will still not work if a 3.0 core profile is requested.)

data.title: Backspace in iOS with non-continuous rendering issue.
[REQUEST] PNG compression on PixmapIO
data.body: I'd like to ask to have a option to compress PNG images saved with PixmapIO. Currently if I load a 25kB PNG to a pixmap and re-export it with PixmapIO again to PNG, the exported will be bloated to reach the size of 500kB, which is very undesirable.

data.title: Add isOnscreenKeyboardVisisble to Input. Fix closing keyboard in iOS
data.body:
- Creates getter for UITextField on iOS for customization of the keyboard
- Adds method `setKeyboardCloseOnReturnKey (boolean shouldClose)` to IOSInput
- Adds boolean entry `keyboardCloseOnReturn` in `IOSApplicationConfiguration`
- Throws keyDown and keyTyped event for the shouldClose event

Related PR #2211

data.title: BASIC ios vibrate, boo apple
data.body:
Basic vibrating functionality in iOS.

As far as I can tell, this is about it. Unless you use private API, and then Apple reject your app from the store.

Thought some functionality may be better than none.

data.title: TextureRegion does not draw properly if flip and size was changed
data.body: If you flip your texture region and then change it size, then it draws just clamped part of texture. I believe the reason of this behavior in the draw function of the SpriteBatch class, because It ignore is the region was flip or not.

data.title: Color fix
data.body: Fixing a typo I guess.

data.title: [Improvement-Bug] Show virtual keyboard for textfield when clicked
data.body:
Hi, I am developing an game has a user's profile screen, it contains many user's informations like name,address,phone,id,money,... each of user's information is a textfield and all of those textfields are put in a scrollpane. Yeah the problem is when scrolling the scrollpane the virtual keyboard always show because touching down in the textfield. And then the focused textfield was moved out of visible bounds.
So can you fix the textfield is only show the virtual keyboard when clicked ? Or make a method let me override it for modifying ?
Thanks.

data.title: Fix IOSGraphics density by simply setting density == scale for all cases
data.body:
This change will remove complexity around calculating density, and uses the non-integer scale values that are calculated elsewhere using UIScreen.nativeScale

iPhone 6 in zoomed mode and iPhone 6+ in zoomed or regular mode never have an integer scale in practice, at least not nativeScale which is what is relevant for OpenGl.

data.title: Fix IOSGraphics density by simply setting density == scale for all cases
Building a version besides the very top of tree fails because of RoboVM
data.body:
Hi-

I was trying to build version 1.4.1 today, but it fetches the top of RoboVM tree which has an incompatible change with release 1.4.1.

LibGDX should either include the correct version of robovm in its releases, or fetch a specific SHA1 which is known to be compatible.

The error in this case was UITouch.getLocation being changed to UITouch.getLocationInView in RoboVM.

data.title: Allow Label to wrap at hyphens
data.body:
This commit will allow the Label to break at the hyphen (-) character, as well as whitespace.
This is optional; default behavior remains the same.
This was suggested in #2486 
Behaviour has been tested:
![labelwraptest](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7389241/4760029/415553e8-5aec-11e4-9b96-4aaf7b7f3130.PNG)

data.title: [Android] TextField and OnScreenKeyBoard error !
data.body:
Hi,
I using TextField to input string. When i use SamSung (Samsung Galaxy S3) keyboard, the keyboard always pop. But when I type anything, it don't display any letters. The problems seems to appear only when "predictive text" is enabled. Please, fix it. It is really uncomfortable :(

data.title: Add critical arrays to gl interface
data.body:
This PR isn't ready for pulling yet. Having a PR makes it a bit easier on github to see and test the changes.
I accidentally included #2474 into this PR as well.

This adds optional support for java arrays instead of buffers to the GL20 interface. Leaving it up to the backend on how to translate between the java array and the opengl call. This removes the sometimes unneeded copy from java array to buffer and back.

Only added the most obvious methods (genbuffer, uniformfv, etc). I've tested the implementation of lwjgl and android (e.g. by running SkeletonTest, probably needs more testing though). I did implement, but haven't tested GWT yet. Haven't looked at the RoboVM and jglfw implementation yet.

data.title: AsyncExecutor - threads never disposed
data.body:
I have observed an anomalous behaviour. When running my libgdx game the numbers of threads always increase. The problem seems to be related to the use of AsyncExecutor. 

I used the jvisualvm tool to monitoring the behaviour. I don't use directly this class. 
I'm using the collection classes in the com.badlogic.gdx.utils package.

data.title: Make iPhone 6+ behave more sensibly.
data.body:
The iPhone 6+ behaves badly without this.  It returns a density of 1 which makes apps think its a very very large screen (vs a regular screen with very small pixels). Note that this also affects ppiX & ppiY (et al), but in an appropriate way.

This is not a perfect fix for density on iOS, but it's a decent bandaid for now.

data.title: Add setPosition to Music interface, and implement.
data.body:
Tested on all backends, working on all but Lwjgl backend. 

I've left the implementation that _should_ work, if anyone has any ideas...

MusicTest has been adjusted so you can test.

data.title: Allow Label to wrap at dashes

[enhancement]
I'd like to be able to wrap text around dashes "-" to prevent the following case ("Raum-Zeit-Kontinuum"):

data.title: adding setPosition
data.body:
Music method "setPosition" was partially implemented, I finished implementing it and added it in interface Music.
Now available on all backends.

Remark : not tested on all backends

data.title: Fix warnings about JRE 1.6
data.body:
A number of projects had the JRE System Library set to "JavaSE-1.6" which causes the following error message when only JDK 7 is installed: _"Build path specifies execution environment JavaSE-1.6. There are no JREs installed in the workspace that are strictly compatible with this environment."_

Since [we require JDK 7+](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Setting-up-your-Development-Environment-%28Eclipse%2C-Intellij-IDEA%2C-NetBeans%29) most people will probably not have JDK 6 installed as well.

I have changed the JRE System Library to use "Workspace Default JRE" and instead enforced the JDK 1.6 Compiler Compliance level. (A number of projects were already set up that way) This eliminates the warning while still ensuring the use of Java 6 API only since Java 7 is unsupported before Android Lollipop.

data.title: GWT: Fixed coordinates for touch and mouse events with CSS scaling
data.body: Fixed a bug where GWTInput was not scaling mouse/touch coordinates correctly when CSS scaling was applied to a Canvas element (i.e. when not 1:1)

data.title: Value.percent(Width or Height) doesn't work without specifying an actor
data.body:
If I do this, 

```
add(loginTable).fill().center().size(Value.percentWidth(.75f), Value.percentHeight(.6f));
```

the width and height will be 0, I need to specify the actor to base off of with

```
add(loginTable).fill().center().size(Value.percentWidth(.75f, this), Value.percentHeight(.6f, this));
```

then it will work. I never had to do this till I just updated libgdx about a week ago

data.title: Build 1.4.1 - Slider value
data.body:
Hi I updated one of my projects from 1.3.1 to 1.4.1 and there seems to be an issue with the slider value being reset to default.

Hoe i could tell is i set the value to 50 and 2 lines later on the logcat  output it would jump back to the default value.

Best

Daniel

data.title: Differences in TextButton layout when adding to a Table
data.body:
When I add a TextButton to a Table layout, there is a difference in display, depending on how it is initialized and added to the table. When I initialize the TextButton within the add method: ``` java Table table = new Table(); table.add(new TextButton("Here is some text", skin)).row(); ``` the button is properly sized according to the text it contains: 
#####################
# Here is some text #
#####################
however, if I initialize the TextButton and assign it to a variable: ``` java Table table = new Table(); TextButton button = new TextButton("Here is some text", skin); table.add(button).row(); ``` the TextButton's containing background is shorter than the text (until you actually click the button, then it will size appropriately): 
 ###############
Here is some text
 ###############
I originally found similar behavior in v1.1.0, but am seeing the same issue after upgrading to the latest v1.4.1. Thanks.

data.title: HTML games' keyboard input problem in iframe.
data.body:
HTML games' keyboard input isn't working (but mouse input is working.) in iframe and when I play the game without iframe then keyboard input working.

here is my game in which I have tested ( many others games tested too ) : http://ravicake.itch.io/pong-simple

data.title: Small bugfix with regards to PolygonSprite Color usage
data.body:
Small bugfix which ensures that the Color variable in PolygonSprite is set all over, instead of querying the vertex colors. (Which can differ from the actual set color due to packing).

Also fixes bug where current color isn't used to set vertex color when setRegion is used. (As color wasn't being maintained)

Bests,

data.title: gdx-setup: Add gdx-ai and update version of Ashley
